data.title: Breaking the Ice (Kasa Games)
data.descriptions: Starting a conversation with a stranger can be a daunting experience, especially if you're attracted to the person. But fear not - in this episode, the tribe is here to help you break the ice and strike up memorable conversations with anyone you meet! We begin by exploring some of our favorite icebreakers and conversation starters, designed to get you comfortable with starting conversations with strangers. From clever pick-up lines to thoughtful questions, we share our tried-and-true strategies for sparking engaging and memorable interactions. But that's not all - we also play another round of Kasa Games, our signature game that's all about connecting and having fun. Through various scenarios and challenges, we put our conversation skills to the test and work on improving our ability to connect with others in meaningful ways. Whether you're looking to break the ice with a potential love interest, make new friends, or simply improve your conversation skills, this episode has something for you. Join us for a fun and informative discussion on icebreakers, conversation starters, and Kasa Games, and remember to subscribe to our podcast for more exciting content. Follow us on social media for updates on our latest episodes and exclusive content

data.title: Humanity and Artificial intelligence
data.descriptions: The tribe dives into the rollout of artificial intelligence-augmented browsers by Microsoft, with the 'new bing' causing a lot of confusion and questions around the true capabilities of AI. We discuss some of the stories that have developed this week and offer our take on the possible causes of these flaws.As we explore the topic of artificial intelligence, we also touch on the importance of humanizing these technologies and understanding users' role in training chatbots and other AI systems. We discuss how to see and relate to these chatbots in a productive way.Whether you're a tech enthusiast, a skeptic of AI, or simply interested in the latest trends and developments in technology, this episode has something for you. Join us for a thought-provoking discussion on the intersection of human and artificial intelligence,and don't forget to subscribe to our podcast for more informative and entertaining content.

data.title: Exploring the Intersection of Internet Security and Artificial Intelligence
data.descriptions: In this episode, the tribe dives into the complex and rapidly evolving world of internet security and artificial intelligence, exploring the latest advancements in AI technology and their impact on online safety. We analyze AI's potential risks and benefits and offer insights into how individuals and organizations can protect themselves in the digital age. We discuss the role of AI in detecting and mitigating cyber threats, as well as the potential risks of AI-powered attacks and surveillance. We also offer practical tips for safeguarding your online activity, from using strong passwords to adopting multi-factor authentication. Whether you're a tech enthusiast or simply concerned about online security, this video will provide you with valuable insights and thought-provoking ideas on the intersection of technology and privacy. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more discussions on internet security, artificial intelligence, and emerging technologies.

data.title: Privacy vs. Transparency: Striking a Balance in the Age of Data Collection
data.descriptions: In today's world, technology has made it easier for governments and corporations to collect data on individuals, raising questions about the balance between privacy and transparency. In this video, the tribe delves into this contentious topic, exploring the various facets of the issue and offering insights into how we can strike a balance between the need for privacy and the desire for transparency. We discuss the implications of government surveillance and data privacy regulations, as well as the responsibility of corporations in protecting user data. We also provide practical tips for protecting your privacy in the digital age, including using encryption tools and being mindful of your online activity. Whether you're concerned about privacy violations or interested in the broader implications of data collection, this video will provide you with valuable insights and practical solutions for navigating this complex issue. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more discussions on technology, ethics, and personal growth.

data.title: Why Millennials Are Delaying Settling Down: The Role of Education, Economics, and Shame
data.descriptions: Are millennials really falling behind in hitting social milestones like settling down? Our tribe believes there's more to the story. In this video, we continue the conversation on why millennials are delaying settling down and provide insights into the role of education, economics, and shame in this trend. From rising student debt to changing societal norms, there are many factors that are reshaping the way millennials approach relationships and family planning.We also discuss how shame and social pressure can impact a person's decision to settle down and start a family and offer strategies for overcoming these challenges. Whether you're a millennial or simply curious about this social issue, this video will provide you with valuable insights and practical advice to help you navigate the challenges of settling down in today's world. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more discussions on relationships, culture, and personal growth for millennials and beyond

data.title: Debunking the Myth: Why Millennials Want to Settle Down and Get Married
data.descriptions: Are millennials really averse to settling down and getting married? Our tribe thinks otherwise! In this video, we delve into the factors that fuel this myth and provide insights into why millennials are delaying marriage and committed relationships. From financial challenges to changing societal expectations, there are many reasons why millennials are approaching marriage differently than previous generations. We also address some of the other typical millennial stereotypes and provide a fresh perspective on the values and priorities of this unique generation. Whether you're a millennial yourself or simply curious about this social issue, this video will provide you with valuable insights and thought-provoking ideas. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more discussions on relationships, culture, and personal growth for millennials and beyond

data.title: The Upside of Stable Relationships: How to Build and Maintain Long-Lasting Connections
data.descriptions: Are stable relationships really all that boring? The tribe doesn't think so! In this video, we explore the benefits of stability in relationships and how they can actually be quite fulfilling and rewarding.From building trust and deeper connections to weathering the ups and downs of life together, there's so much to gain from long-lasting relationships. We also discuss how to build and maintain stable relationships, including communication tips, managing conflict, and prioritizing your partner.Whether you're single or in a relationship, this video will provide you with valuable insights and practical advice to help you create and sustain stable, meaningful connections. Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more tips and insights on relationships and personal growth.

data.title: Twiddle Time: Reacting to the Funniest Tweets on Twitter
data.descriptions: Join the tribe as we take a break from the daily grind and twiddle away on Twitter! In this episode, we share our reactions to the funniest tweets we find, keeping the new season light-hearted and fun before the proverbial rubber hits the road. From hilarious memes to witty one-liners, we've scoured Twitter for the best of the best to brighten your day. So sit back, relax, and join us for some good laughs and positive vibes. Don't forget to follow us on Twitter and subscribe to our channel for more fun-filled content!

data.title: Starting the New Year Strong: Our Goals and Aspirations
data.descriptions: The tribe kicks off the new year with a fresh start! In this video, the tribe discusses our goals and aspirations for the new year and how we plan to achieve them. As we embark on a new season, we're excited to share our journey with you and inspire you to start your own fresh start this year. Whether you're looking to improve your health, relationships, or career, this video will provide practical tips and insights to help you get started. Let's make the most of this new year and create the life we truly desire! Don't forget to subscribe to our channel for more inspiration and motivation to start the new year strong.

data.title: The Year in Review: The Tribe's Season Finale Reflections on 2022
data.descriptions: In this season finale episode, The Tribe reflects on the year that was, discussing the good, the bad, and the memorable moments of 2022. We share our personal experiences and insights, offering a unique perspective on the events that shaped the year. We also discuss our plans for the new year, setting goals and sharing our hopes and dreams for the future. We give listeners a sneak peek into what they can expect from the next season of the podcast, promising even more insightful discussions on social issues, personal growth, and emerging trends. Whether you've been with us from the beginning or just tuning in, this season finale episode is a must-listen. Join us for a heartfelt reflection on the year that was and a glimpse into what's to come. Don't forget to subscribe to our podcast for more thought-provoking discussions, and follow us on social media for updates on our latest episodes and exclusive content.

data.title: Fun and Games

They dare to reveal as much in as few words as possible, resulting in a hilarious and revealing conversation. We then turn our attention to the world cup games, discussing the latest developments and sharing our predictions for the group stages and the ultimate winners. data.title: Navigating the Fast-Paced World of Online Connections (Part 2)
data.descriptions: In the wake of a global pandemic, the internet has become an essential tool for connection and communication. But as the online world continues to evolve at breakneck speed, it can be challenging to keep up with the latest trends and best practices for establishing a strong internet presence. In this episode, The Tribe offers insights into how to survive and thrive in the fast-paced world of online connections. We discuss tools and strategies for growing your internet presence and networks, as well as the dos and don'ts of various social media platforms. From sharing personal experiences to offering practical tips, our guests provide a wealth of knowledge on establishing and maintaining strong online connections. data.title: Knowing your tribe
data.descriptions: Knowing your tribe is a series in which we get to know the cast of the Kasa Podcast. Today we get to know about Kwadwo.Afia asks all the questions we have a been thinking. Enjoy getting to know Kwadwo!!!#Kasa #KasaPodcast #Knowingyourtribe

data.title: Summer movie recommendations
data.descriptions: It's almost Summer!!! And the tribe has a few summer movie recommendations for you!! The tribe goes through the 2022 movie release calendar from January to December and review the ones that have been released and also share their thoughts on the forthcoming ones. #Kasa #KasaPodcast #Movies #SummerMovieRecommendations Link to the other flix episodehttps://anchor.fm/kasathetribe/episodes/19--Summer-FLIX-e14fmbm

data.title: It is Prime Time!!!!
data.descriptions: The tribe spends some time with one of the most influential members of the tribe in Prime Time!!! Prime has several stories and lessons on starting business both in and out of Ghana, managing finance, building connections, and a whole lot of basketball!!! The conversation with Prime touches on all these areas of his interest and knowledge and is aimed at sharing the lessons learnt over the year with the Tribe! #Kasa #KasaPodcast #PrimeTime #Time

data.title: Let's go see the World cup!!!
data.descriptions: The World cup is upon us again!!! The Qatar 2022 World cup draw was help in Doha and the Tribe is making plans to go see the games already. The tribe talks about the World Cup qualifiers, the draw and the tournament expectations. They then get into how they are planning to head to the World Cup games. They provide a step-by-step information piece to get you to Qatar!! #Kasa #KasaPodcast #WorldCup #Qatar2022

data.title: 1 2 3 react
data.descriptions: The tribe reacts to the 3music awards and discuss the big winners, losers and all the snubs!!! They also use the 3 awards to predict the winners of the VGMA!! And it's Oscars night! a little flix conversation as lagniappe

data.title: Living away from home
data.descriptions: Living away from home can be very challenging for young adults. Whatever the reason may be, having to live by yourself away from home, family, and social support presents its own challenges. The tribe shares their experience living away from home. Their journeys, their expectations, the adjustments they made and the lessons they learned along the way. #Kasa #KasaPodcast #Livingawayfromhome

data.title: Kweku Ananse stories
data.descriptions: Kweku Ananse is a revered mythological character in Ghanaian folklore. The tribe gets into some of the famous stories told to Ghanaians as the grow up. The share the lessons from these stories and compete against each other for the crown of "best story teller". Get to know more about Kweku in this episode.#Kasa #KasaPodcast #KwekuAnanse #KwekuAnanseStories

data.title: Stories of a Ghanaian child
data.descriptions: Every Ghanaian child has loads of stories. It is independence day in Ghana and the tribe shares their "Ghanaian child" stories. Stories about growing up, childhood games, Ghanaian food, Ghanaian tourist sites and all the various things they enjoyed growing up in Ghana. #Kasa #KasaPodcast #IndependenceDay #Ghana #Ghanaianchild

data.title: High School days
data.descriptions: The tribe goes back to High School!!! They share their stories from the first day in high school till the last day! The fun stories, love stories, horror stories, regrettable moments, super zonals, Brilla, facing the bullies, and all other stories from High school.#KasaPodcast #Kasa #HighSchool

data.title: Were your expectations met?
data.descriptions: The tribe had loads of Expectations and plans for their Valentines day!! How did it all go for them? Were these expectations met? Did they get the gifts they wanted? Did it all go according to plan? Well, if it did not, how do they manage their expectations; for the next Vals day and life in general.#KasaPodcast #Kasa #Expectations

data.title: Let's talk Valentine
data.descriptions: It is Valentine day weekend!! The tribe shares all their Valentine's day plans and talk about the gifts they are giving out! They share some tips on classy, easy on the pocket, last minute valentines day gifts. They also get into the Super Bowl and make some predictions about the game, talk about the half time show and some of the commercials they are excited to see. #ValentinesDay #Valentine #Kasa #KasaPodcast---This episode is sponsored by· Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast.  https://anchor.fm/app

data.title: Valentine's Day gifts/ideas to avoid
data.descriptions: Valentine's day is around the corner!! We are in the month of LOVE!!! Valentine's day is coming up and you might be struggling to get some fresh ideas to surprise your partner. Guess what, there are some gifts your partner would probably, like most of the tribe, not like!! Hahaha I might even be bold to say, they might HATE some of these gifts. Check out the tribe get into some of these ideas!!---This episode is sponsored by· Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast.  https://anchor.fm/app

data.title: Books Books Books 2
data.descriptions: The tribe decided to read a lot more this year and the challenge has been on!! Books books books. 📚📚📚This episode explores the books the tribe has read so far in 2022 and their recommendations. They explore the books in details and tell a bit of the story to wet you reading appetite!!

data.title: Turning failure into fuel for success
data.descriptions: The tribe talks about how to turn setbacks and failures into lessons and fuel on our journey to success. They share some tips that can be very useful in diagnosing situations and learning the most out of every missed opportunity to help better prepare yourself for the next one. The road to success is not a straight path and lessons missed can be costly down the line. #Success #KasaPodcast #Goals #FuelforSUCCESS

data.title: How to Create the Best Graduate School Application.
data.descriptions: In this episode, Kwadwo has a one-on-one chat with David Sobek, PhD on how to create the best application packet for graduate school in the US. David shares a wealth of knowledge and experience, offering tips and advice for crafting a strong statement of purpose and securing solid recommendations from professors.They also discuss some healthy habits and practices that can help students succeed in their graduate studies, from time management to stress management and more. And for some added fun and entertainment, we get into live-streaming games and some Fortnite action.Whether you're a prospective graduate student or simply interested in thought-provoking discussions and fun, engaging content, this episode has something for you. Join us for an insightful and entertaining conversation on graduate school applications and more, and don't forget to subscribe to our podcast for more informative and entertaining discussions. Follow us on social media for updates on our latest…

data.title: Chasing goals
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into ways to hope achieve their new year goals!And share tips and tricks that they hope to use to get over the line!! They also get into conversations on the AFCON 2021 and Dee give her predictions for the first round of games.NAG drops an "Andriod" joke!!!

data.title: New Year, New Tribe: The Tribe Returns for a Season of Reflection and Growth
data.descriptions: The Tribe is back for another season, and it's a new year with new opportunities for growth and reflection. In this episode, we get together to discuss some big questions for the new year, including our main targets, habits we want to get rid of, and what we're going to avoid in 2022. We share our personal insights and experiences, offering a unique perspective on the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead. Nag also shares some big revelations about perfection, inspiring us to let go of our unrealistic expectations and embrace our imperfections. Whether you're looking for motivation and inspiration in the new year or simply interested in thought-provoking discussions on social issues and personal growth, this episode is a must-listen. Join us for a new season of the podcast and a renewed commitment to personal and collective growth. Don't forget to subscribe to our podcast for more insightful discussions, and follow us on social media for updates on our latest episodes…

data.title: Season Finale
data.descriptions: The tribe wraps up 2021 and end the season with a review of the journey of the first season. The tribe talks about the highs and lows of the podcast journey and the lessons they learnt along the way.They also promise an even bigger season 2 which involve livestreams on Facebook and YouTube and hope to get a lot more audience engagements.The YouTube channel is @Kasa Podcast https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGFnofILLEcUTy2s6hc1xCAhit that subscribe button and turn on your notifications!!!

data.title: Keep it fun; stay happy
data.descriptions: The tribe raise awareness on mental health as they celebrate the mental health awareness month. They also try to challenge listeners to go on "happy journeys". Wendy joins twitter (@sweetnanafr) and gets the guys on there fighting already.

data.title: Friends or not?
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into how it's okay to drift apart from some friends when y'all in different seasons in life. This raises the question of which kinds of friends are okay to drift away from and which ones cannot fit the bill. Ekow raises the most delicate question of all " Can boys and girls be friends?". The tribe argue it out and finally get to two key answers...........

data.title: The subtle art of ghosting
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into conversation on "ghosting" and "airing" in this fast-paced world. They come up with some reasons why people ghost and things that can reduce the chances of getting ghosted. Ekow attempts to snitch a little but Afia retains her crown by snitching on her dad!

data.title: Social media
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into conversations on the good, bad, and ails of social media. They get into some heartwarming stuff that happen on there and share some ideas on how to avoid the "not so pleasant" side of the medium.

data.title: Knowing me knowing you
data.descriptions: The tribe plays a game of questions and answers to get to know each other a little more. New tribe member, Wendy, gets her own baptism of fire as some questions get her in a tight spot and Ekow gets called out!!!The tribe drops the Twitter and IG handles again. Give them a followTwitter@Kasa_theTribe, @just_quajjo. @ephya_yeboah, @Papakow8Instagram@kasa_thetribe, @miss_afia_yeboah, @nanaekownyarkson, @sweet_nana_frSnapchat@just_quajjo, @nanayaaboateng

data.title: Respect
data.descriptions: The Tribe gets into the question of whether respect is earned or given. Dede and Afia dive into a couple of rabbit holes while the boys try to keep up.Afia makes a prediction for the UEFA Champions League!!The tribe drops the Twitter and IG handles again. Give them a followTwitter@Kasa_theTribe, @just_quajjo. @ephya_yeboah, @Papakow8, @chris_kuetsinyaInstagram@dr.adote, @kasa_thetribe, @miss_afia_yeboah, @nanaekownyarkson, @chris_kuetsinya

data.title: Red Flags
data.descriptions: the tribe gets into some attributes and traits they consider to be red flags in friendships, romantic relationships, school, and career paths. Dede drops an interesting though on "masturbating the mind" that gets everyone shocked and asking for more details on the thought.The tribe also drops the Twitter and IG handles again. Give them a followTwitter@Kasa_theTribe, @just_quajjo. @Papakow8, @chris_kuetsinya, @gistwithdeeInstagram@dr.adote, @kasa_thetribe, @nanaekownyarkson, @chris_kuetsinya @__efya__

data.title: Ready or Not?
data.descriptions: The Tribe gets ready for new challenges this fall and discuss tricks that helps you get ready in as short a time as possible. Dede joins the tribe and brings a lot of vibrance and wit ti the conversation. The tribe also drops the Twitter and IG handles again. Give them a followTwitter@Kasa_theTribe, @just_quajjo. @ephya_yeboah, @gistwithdeeInstagram@dr.adote, @kasa_thetribe, @miss_afia_yeboah, @__efya__

data.title: Little things - part 2
data.descriptions: The tribe continues the conversation on the little things that make a big difference. They get into first impressions, fashion, and education. Afia also asks for help with a DJ name. Share your suggestions on all the social media platforms. Enjoy!!!

data.title: Little things - part 1
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into little things that makes a difference in our finances, our success in the workplace, and in our relationships with friends and family. They drop some major keys and get into some rather overlooked tricks that can go a long way in achieving success and financial independence.

data.title: Summer FLIX
data.descriptions: The tribe goes through the 2021 movie release calendar from January to December and review the ones that have been released and also share their thoughts on the forthcoming ones. Afia celebrates Messi's Copa America win and shuts the guys up about the "Messi is the GOAT" argument.

data.title: Delayed reactions
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into the 2021 Vodafone Ghana Music awards (VGMA) and rate the categories, winners, and performances. Kwadwo talks about his trip to Ghana and get into some of the development news in Ghana. The tribe gives their take on the 1 district 1 factory initiative in Ghana and suggest ways it can be improved.

data.title: Ghana Kasa
data.descriptions: In the first episode of Kasa recorded on the motherland, Kwadwo sits down with four new tribe members to discuss rewards of their careers. They share some of their experiences on the non-monetary rewards of work and teaching. Meet the new tribe members;Jemima - (IG - @yaa_ampong , T - @YaaAmponggg)Mina - (IG - @minapokuagyemang , T - @Mz.Scaizy)Kobby - (IG - @quolby , T - @quolby)Kwabena - (IG - @__cobe_jr , T - @Deekayyy3)The tribe also explores whether it is smart to stay in touch with an ex when you are in a committed relationship.

data.title: Tell me your story, John
data.descriptions: Kwadwo sits down with a tech entrepreneur, John Oamen, in a special episode to go through his journey from the streets to building a global tech brand.John shares so many great stories from his childhood, through his young adult life to his success as the CEO of CutStruct Technology Limited. He share so many nuggets of information that is bound to make you reach for a notepad and a pen!!You can connect with John Oamen onLinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnoamen/),Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/john.oamen.39)Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/johnoamen/)

data.title: Let's Ted talk
data.descriptions: The tribe share some interesting and not so interesting Ted talks they've watched. They discuss the lessons they learned from these talks and give a recommendations list.1. How algorithms shape our world - Kevin Slavin (2011) [Justin]2. How to speak so that people want to listen - Julian Treasure (2013) [Chris]3. 5 Hinderances to self-mastery - Master Shi Heng Yi (2020) [Afia]4. How great leaders inspire action - Simon Sinek (2010) [Kwadwo]5. Paper towns and why learning is awesome - John Green (2015) [Justin]6. Unwavering focus - Dandapani (2016) [Afia]7. The danger of silence - Clint Smith (2014) [Justin]8. How to start a movement - Derek Sivers (2014) [Justin]9. 10 things you did not know about orgasms - Mary Reach (2010) {bad one!!!!}The tribe also give their predictions for the Europa league and Champions league finals!!

data.title: Books Books Books
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into a fascinating conversation on literature and help populate an impressive summer reading list.The books suggested include;1. Outliers - Malcolm Gladwell (Fausty)2. Think like a Monk - Jay Shetty (Saachi)3. The power and the glory - Graham Greene (Justin)4. The brothers Karamazov - Fyodor Dostoevsky (Kwadwo)5. The Fall - Albert Camus (Justin)6. Make your bed - William. H McRaven (Fausty)7. Becoming - Michelle Obama (Saachi)8. Choosing me before we - Christine Arylo (Saachi)9. Pretty is what changes - Jessica Queller (Justin)10. The 48 laws of power - Robert Greene (Kwadwo)11. Never look an American in the eye - Okey Ndibe (Justin)12. You can win - Shir Khera (Saachi)13. The secret - Rhonda Byrne (Fausty)14. The promised land - Barack Obama (Kwadwo)15. The republic - Plato (Kwadwo)they also have a good time talking about long words like antidisestablishmentarianism and pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis.Enjoy!!! --- This…

data.title: Leadership - if not you; who?
data.descriptions: The tribe get into leadership and discuss the things that motivate leaders, the challenges leaders face and what it takes to be a good leader."Readers are leaders" - Saachi.New Tribe members, Adam and Justin, bring their wealth of leadership experience to the table and also explore the news from Ghana, India and the US.There is also a giveaway in there somewhere!!! Enjoy!!!

data.title: See what I'm saying?
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into what it takes to be a good listener."Everybody who is listening to you is hearing you but not everyone who is hearing you is listening"- Ekow"A good listener sees what you can't say" - Chris.Angel joins the tribe and drops so many great nuggets on improving our listening.There is also a mysterious pool party that has some tribe members salty......enjoy!!!

data.title: Not gonna stress it!
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into the various ways stress manifests in their personal lives and, without "playing therapists", trade ideas on how they manage their stress. They aim at filling your "stress tool box" with enough tools to help manage all the forms and levels of stress.They also get into the European Super league (ESL) debacle and celebrate the win for the "little guys"

data.title: It's confidence, baby!!!
data.descriptions: The tribe takes a swing at the perceptions of confidence in the society as it pertains to gender. The explore the reasons why some actions are seen as "confident" when it's performed by men and "arrogant" when it comes from women. They trade ideas on how to empower people being pushed down and take a swing at some outdated concepts of gender roles.The tribe also weigh in on the treatment of Polio and share their take on the #freePoloo movement.

data.title: Boundaries.....they're for me; not you!!
data.descriptions: Chris gets the tribe discussing boundaries in relationships this week with the question, "should there even be boundaries anyway?"So many lessons are shared on the need for boundaries and when to set boundaries. The tribe trades interesting issues they wouldn't compromise on in a relationship.

data.title: Story story - The "woes" of match-making
data.descriptions: The gang trades stories on times they've been set up on "match-made" dates! It's not all horror stories though......some juicy beans are spilt!!Kwadwo hints at some good news and Dee finally budges on getting a vaccine!!Dee also takes a bold swing at the week's UCL games!!!

data.title: What are you looking for?
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into things young people look for in friends and potential partners. A very heated conversation ensues and so much fun banter is thrown around.Saachi joins and shamelessly plugs the speakers' forum (https://twitter.com/tsf_lsu) and adds so much to the conversation.---This episode is sponsored by· Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast.  https://anchor.fm/app

data.title: Sorry.........what?
data.descriptions: The tribe takes a look at apologies from three main angles - first, second, and third persons. Afia starts the conversation of with a tricky question - "can you apologize without saying 'I'm sorry'?"Follow on twitter, IG and Facebook and let us know what you think.Did they also get into the Rastafarian issue???.......haha ---This episode is sponsored by· Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast.  https://anchor.fm/app

data.title: Navigating the 20s (part 3) - Relationships
data.descriptions: The tribe get into the challenges young adults encounter in their 20s with their friend groups, romantic partners, and family. Papa Kow (https://www.instagram.com/nanaekownyarkson/) brings some lessons he learnt in his drama-filled week.The tribe gets into the champions league knockouts and trash Manchester United (as https://www.instagram.com/miss_afia_yeboah/ always does).

data.title: Navigating the 20s (part 2) - Career
data.descriptions: The Tribe gets into the challenges associated with beginning the career journey, they talk about job interviews, first days on the job, and managing the work-life balance. They share their experiences with career related issues and drop some helpful tips for people about to get started on their own career journeys and those already in their chosen professions.Dee's predictions are reviewed and she makes two more bold ones.

data.title: Navigating the 20s (part 1) - College
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into the challenges young adults face in their 20s. They share their college experiences and trade tips they used to navigate the college space - academically and socially.Dee also keeps predicting sports outcomes and makes 10 EPL predictions---This episode is sponsored by· Anchor: The easiest way to make a podcast.  https://anchor.fm/app

data.title: Tell me about Valentine
data.descriptions: The tribe gets into ideas for celebrating Valentine's Day; discuss movies and tv shows; and evaluate one another's playlists on Apple Music. Afia's playlist emerges as the best curated playlist give her a follow on Apple Music (@afia_y) and check it out.Dee also predicts sports results again!!

data.title: First dates
data.descriptions: The tribe get into first date experiences and trade helpful first date tips.Kwadwo (@just_quajjo) is joined by Afia (@ephya_yeboah), Ekow (@NNyarkson), Dyna (@gistwithdee) and Chris (@chris_kuetsinya)!!The crew also give their Super Bowl predictions.
